required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Physiological Factors That Influence Maintenance of Lifestyle Changes and Weight Loss - a Cross-sectional Study
clinical_study.official_title: Physiological Factors That Influence Maintenance of Lifestyle Changes and Weight Loss - a Cross-sectional Study

brief_summary.textblock:
In Denmark and the western world, there is an increasing prevalence of obesity probably due to a combination of inadequate daily physical activity and a high energy intake. One approach to achieve weight loss and change life style is to participate in an intensive supervised prolonged life style modification course. The immediate effect is often positive, but over time the overall effect is limited as the majority will not maintain weight loss and a changed life style.
The purpose of this study is therefore to characterize the physiological factors that determine/influence the capacity to maintain weight loss and a healthy lifestyle after a prolonged lifestyle intervention.
The investigators have the following research questions:
1. Are there physiological traits and characteristics that mediate better adherence to lifestyle changes and weight loss?
2. Does the adaptation in muscle oxidative capacity after lifestyle intervention predict success in maintaining weight loss and lifestyle changes?
3. How does gender and age influence the capacity to maintain the lifestyle induced adaptation in muscle and adipose tissue and maintaining weight loss?
The study design is cross-sectional and will be based on a lifestyle intervention, as it is practiced in a real life setting at Ubberup folk high school. The investigators will recruit former participants of this lifestyle style intervention. 50 % who maintained a weight loss and a healthy life style and 50 % who did not.

primary_outcome.time_frame: 0-14 years after the intervention is completed

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 0-14 years after the intervention is completed
secondary_outcome.description: Body composition measured by dual x-ray absorptiometry or bio-impedance, height, weight, waist circumference.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 0-14 years after the intervention is completed
secondary_outcome.description: Respiratoric Exchange Ratio (RER) is measured during an incremental cycling test and maximal fat oxidation is calculated

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 0-14 years after the intervention is completed

other_outcome.time_frame: 0-14 years after the intervention is completed
other_outcome.description: Questionnaire (24hrs dietary recall) and diary to determine adherence to a healthy diet

other_outcome.time_frame: 0-14 years after the intervention is completed
other_outcome.description: International Physical Activity Questionnaire (IPAQ) to determine adherence to physical activity. Furthermore we will use diary and ActiHeart (accelerometer).

other_outcome.time_frame: 0-14 years after the intervention is completed
other_outcome.description: Mitochondria respiration and efficiency measured by Oreboros Oxygraph

other_outcome.measure: Blood and plasma substrates, hormones and metabolites
other_outcome.time_frame: 0-14 years after the intervention is completed
other_outcome.description: HbA1c, insulin, leptin, glucose, adiponectin, thyroid stimulating hormone (TSH), Ghrelin.

other_outcome.time_frame: 0-14 years after the intervention is completed
other_outcome.description: Muscle lipid composition will be analyzed using a lipidomics approach.

other_outcome.time_frame: 0-14 years after the intervention is completed
other_outcome.description: Western Blot analyses will be Applied to analyse expression of muscle lipases; hormone sensitive lipase (HSL), adipose triglyceride lipase (ATGL) and lipoprotein lipase (LPL) as well muscle PAT proteins; PLIN 2 (ADRP), PLIN 3 (TIP47) and PLIN5 (OXPAT)

other_outcome.measure: Adipose tissue macrophage inflammation and cytokine production
other_outcome.time_frame: 0-14 years after the intervention is completed

other_outcome.measure: Intramuscular lipid droplet content and size, glycogen content and ceramide content and location
other_outcome.time_frame: 0-14 years after the intervention is completed
other_outcome.description: Intramuscular lipid droplet content and size, glycogen content and ceramide content and location wil be quantified by immunohistochemical staining of serial cryo-sections of muscle tissue samples that are visualized by confocal microscopy

other_outcome.measure: Motivation for lifestyle changes and sociological factors involved
other_outcome.time_frame: 0-14 years after the intervention is completed

arm_group.description: Former participants of Ubberup Folk High Schools intensive lifestyle intervention programme.

intervention.description: The included subjects has previously participated in the Intensive Lifestyle Intervention intervention at Ubberup Folk High School. This intervention includes daily exercise and a hypocaloric diet (app. -700KCal/day) for 10-14 weeks. Furthermore theoretical and practical education within e.g. Nutrition, exercise and motivational psychology.

biospec_descr.textblock: Whole blood, muscle and fat tissue.

study_pop.textblock: Former participants of Ubberup Folk High School will be included in this study. Ubberup Folk High School is a privately hold externate that teaches lifestyle intervention courses with focus on weight loss. A stay at Ubberup has a duration of 10-14 weeks and is primarily self-financed. The study population will consist of men and women of two different age Groups (18-35 and 35-65yr). We will recruit participants who succeeded in maintaining the weight loss and participants who regained in weight.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Former participants of Ubberup Folk High School
Exclusion Criteria:
- Gastric Bypass Surgery or Gastric Banding

overall_official.affiliation: University of Copenhagen, Department of Biomedical Sciences

facility.name: University of Copenhagen, Department of Biomedical Sciences
